bboxes.raw_text:
Last year SIS Americans were
killed and over $4,000 more were
injured in automobile accidents
during the four day Memorial
Day holiday.


Arizona's toll was 304 acct
dents, 9 fatalities and 225 per-
sons injured.


With thousands Of Arizona mo-
florists taking to the road for
the first long holiday weekend
of the summer. chances are good
for excessive additional acct
dents and fatalities, unless
everyone exercises extreme eau
ton in their driving.


Traffic lawMolations and other
unsafe driving will contribute to
9 out of 10 Of the many motor
vehicle accidents that will mar
the Memorial Day weekend. the
Arizona Traffic Safety Founda-
tion reminded motorists today.


Actually" the Foundation
commented, "the same thing hap
pens every day. On holidays,
there's more driving--so, more
danger"


What category Of bad driving
will contribute to the most holi-
day accidents7


considering all accidents
fatal, pers onal injury, and pro-
perty damage the No. l factor
Excluding drinking) will be fol-
lowing too closely. 1t will figure
in l out of E accidents.

walkers have legal duty to be CAREFUL since
do the harm they have the greater duty


Pedestrians legal right drivers to obey traffic
passing drivers watch for pedestrians who may
tem especially crosswaks where walkers have the
right of vay sidewalks and highway shoulders


walkers bad judgment mistake not excuse motorst
accident driver should allow wide margin for such



AS walker though you have legal duty to be careful
to consider Clothes
age speed and coseness Of oncomng and the like
pedestrians lack of does give driver right
he still should avoid mshap matter who Is
blame.


disobeys traffic laws himself his folly may help
and thus lose himhs right revocer damages
Most driver should give special
small children. They do play around diveways and are pu
So them before back into the street and make sure
they safe.


You have legal duty look for workers protected by signs
flares flags the highway The law such woknen
spend their time work and not in lodging cars


This legal column is issued public service under super
the State Bar Arizona and written INFORM not to
advise.

PISA convention committee will
meet at 2 pm on the first and
second Sundays Of June only. All
other meetings are every Sunday
at 4 pm. Please be present.


Dispensation has been granted
by GER Hobson Reynolds: June
'24-2S. He will attend the con-
vention. Also, attending will be
CDR Nettie B. Smith and CDS
Buena Kelley.


Daughters dispensationi Is still
on. The lodge brothers end June
3Oth.


PISA delegates from our temple
are Dts. Mary Boozer, Alice
Wheeler, Cinderella Weaver,
Alberta Perkins, Florence Ses-
sions: PDRC delegates include
Dts. Gertrude Clements, Louise
Becton and Villa Mae Hunter.


Temple election Of officers
will be held June S.


Mrs. Jean Carr, has returned
from visiting her ailing mother
in Terrell, Texas. She was away
for ten weeks.


Junior Matinee, LIST Sunday In
June; At pm. 25f Donation
child accompanied by parent.
Chairman Is DIT. Margaret Ross.


DIT. Alberta Perkins announces
the Hat Sunday. second Sunday In
June, 3:30-E3o pm. Donation ST..
Cash prizes.


Sick List-Dt. Elizabeth Turner
is at Memorial Hospital, J West
#26.


Our oldest Elk, Bonnie Nichol-
son. ga, Is ailing at home, in the
Henson Project Apt. 70.


Minor Byers, Of Flagstaff, is
recuperating from heart surgery
at St. Luke's Hospital.

Primarily speaking, this hat was
inspired by you know who. But whether
you lean toward Lyndon or have picked


Barry, this modified Western hat will
make you feel at home on the range or
dashing about town. The crown of this

Panaire straw is lower and the brim is
narrower but the high, wide and
handsome styling is thoroughly West
ern. Democrat or Republican, this is
sure to win your straw vote. In smart
new Desert Tan shade.

BRAND NEwsl THE IBy HAITI
Il cool shu1V versiom Of the 5-galzon hat
that fits all camdidates!


8.95 by Dobbs

Try cleaning diamonds, shin
ing silver, gold or any metal
jewelry with toothpaste and an
old soft toothbrush. 1t gives a
nice luster.





A large corsage pin is an ideal
stopper for small cans of oil or
tubes of glue. 1t also keeps the
hole unclogged.

ADRIANNE'S BEAUTY SALON
l4l8 E. Washington
25s-O5ll

drive to Oklahoma. Leave the
